policy.title: Cornell University Artificial Intelligence in Education Policy 2025
principles: Academic Integrity: Students must acknowledge AI use in their work
Transparency: Faculty should disclose AI use in course materials
Responsible Use: AI should enhance learning, not replace thinking
Equity: Equal access to AI tools for all students
Privacy: Student data used by AI systems must be protected

allowed_uses.description: Using AI to generate ideas for essays, projects, or research
Using AI to review code quality and identify bugs
Using AI to summarize papers or find relevant sources
Using AI for grammar, style, and clarity improvement
Using AI as a tutor or study aid

prohibited_uses.description: Presenting AI output without modification or citation as student's own work
prohibited_uses.consequences: Academic integrity violation, possible course failure

prohibited_uses.description: Using AI tools on exams, quizzes, or closed-book assessments without permission
Using AI in ways that violate existing Cornell academic integrity policies

format_options.description: Include comment in work: 'I used [Tool] to [Action]'
format_options.example: I used ChatGPT to brainstorm essay topics

format_options.description: Add citation at end of work
format_options.example: ChatGPT (OpenAI, 2025) was used for grammar review

format_options.description: Submit separate document listing AI use

incorporate_into_syllabus: Explicitly state AI use policy for the course
Provide examples of appropriate AI use
Clarify when AI use is prohibited
assessment_design: Design assessments that are difficult to fake with AI
Include reflective components (why did you make this choice?)
Use in-class assessments to verify learning
support_students: Host workshops on responsible AI use
Encourage critical evaluation of AI output

key_principles: Transparency is the foundation of AI use in academics
AI should enhance your learning, not replace thinking
Always disclose AI use as requested by faculty
Critically evaluate AI output before using it
Understand the policies of each course

good: ✅ 'I used ChatGPT to brainstorm essay topics and outline my argument'
✅ 'GitHub Copilot suggested lines 15-20 of this code'
✅ 'I used Grammarly for grammar and style checking'
avoid: ❌ Submitting AI output with no disclosure
❌ Vague statement like 'I used AI' without details
